{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3527595,"name":"Gerardo","username":"jerry.origin","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jerry.origin/{size}/253430_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-15T00:40:33.201Z","cooked":"

Hi, I am trying to configure my XboxController keybinds with some commands, but since I have no robot yet I am just trying to figure out all the logic first, I am trying with a simple System.out.println but it does not seem to work, help is appreciated.

CommandXbox controller m_operatorController = new CommandXboxController(OIConstants.kOperatorControllerPort);

Trigger operator_xButton = m_operatorController.x();

Command runCommandTest = new RunCommand(() → testSubsystem.runCommandTest(), testSubsystem);

operator_xButton.onTrue(runCommandTest);

This as “new PrintCommand” instead of “runCommandTest” does work for in some reason

Try changing the name of the command, maybe there is a conflict with imports because the function you’re calling and the command have the same name, Also may i ask what being called inside the runCommandTest() function?
